utterances.speaker: JESSE WATTERS, HOST
utterances.utterance: Welcome to "Watters' World," I'm Jessie Watters.  Nancy Pelosi got the gavel and the left is already starting to unravel - that is the subject of tonight's "Watters' Words." Congrats to Nancy.  She got what she deserved and what did she get?  The Caracas Caucus.  Caracas is the capital of Venezuela and by the way we're going to have a geography quiz at the end of the show so stick around for that. Her members think Hugo Chavez had the right idea.  Let's take a look at their agenda.  One universal health care - price tag $30 trillion dollars.  Math is hard when you're a socialist.  Two, a green new deal.  This is a government takeover of the entire economy.  The goal: Eliminate oil and gas. Now for someone who flies all the time, solar-powered planes, it sounds a little risky to me.  How do they pay for it?  Freshman Congresswoman Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez wants to raise taxes to 70%.

utterances.speaker: REP. ALEXANDRIA OCASIO-CORTEZ, D-N.Y.
utterances.utterance: Once you get to like the tippy tops on your ten millionth dollar, sometimes you see tax rates as high as 60% or 70%.  That doesn't mean all $10 million are taxed at an extremely high rate, but it means that as you climb up this ladder, you should be contributing more.

utterances.speaker: ANDERSON COOPER, ANCHOR, CNN
utterances.utterance: What you are talking about just big picture is a radical agenda compared to the way politics is done right now.

utterances.speaker: OCASIO-CORTEZ
utterances.utterance: Well, I think that it only has ever been radicals that have changed this country.  Abraham Lincoln made the radical decision to sign the Emancipation Proclamation.  Franklin Delano Roosevelt made the radical decision to embark on establishing programs like Social Security.  That is radical.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.utterance: Do you call  yourself a radical?

utterances.speaker: OCASIO-CORTEZ
utterances.utterance: Yes, you know if that's what radical means, call me a radical.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: She just compared herself to Lincoln and FDR.  Cocky.  I like it.  But you can raise taxes on every American to 70% and you still can't pay for all of her fantasies.  Number three, they want a guaranteed wage, which I may need if I'm fired, but until then, I'll take my chances. Pelosi's people want to abolish ICE, chase families out of restaurants and are already insulting half the country and comparing President Trump to Hitler.  Here's Representative Hank Johnson of Georgia.

utterances.speaker: REP. HANK JOHNSON, D-GA.
utterances.utterance: Donald Trump supporters are older, less educated, less prosperous and they are dying early.  Their lifespans are decreasing and many are dying from alcoholism, drug overdoses, liver disease or simply a broken heart caused by economic despair. Americans, particularly black Americans can't afford to make that same mistake about the harm that could be done by a man named Hitler -- or a man named Trump.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: By the way, Congressman Johnson said that in a church.  They also want to impeach the President, for what?  I have no idea.  Here's Rashida Tlaib, the new Muslim congresswoman from Michigan.

utterances.speaker: REP. RASHIDA TLAIB, D-MICH.
utterances.utterance: When your son looks at you and says, "Mama, look you won.  Bullies don't win," and I said, "Baby, they don't.  Because we are going to go in there and we're going to impeach the [bleep]."

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: She looks like a lot of fun, doesn't she?  And by the way, if you impeach Trump, you get President Pence.  Now imagine what kind of judges he'll name to the Supreme Court.  They'll look - make Kavanaugh look like Ruth Bader Ginsburg, but the Democrats don't care. In their first act, Democratic Congressman Brad Sherman introduced Articles of Impeachment.  The second thing they did, introduced a bill to repeal the Electoral College.  They really can't get over 2016, can they?

utterances.speaker: REP. NANCY PELOSI, D-CALIF., SPEAKER OF THE HOUSE
utterances.utterance: I now call the House to order on behalf of all of America's children.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Here to respond, former Arkansas governor and Fox News contributor Mike Huckabee and the chairman of America Fighting Back, Herman Cain. All right, we'll start with you, Huckabee.  What did you think about my brilliant commentary?

utterances.speaker: MIKE HUCKABEE, FORMER GOVERNOR, ARKANSAS
utterances.utterance: It was brilliant.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: HUCKABEE
utterances.utterance: Jesse, what can I say?  It was brilliant.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Thank you, not much - yes.

utterances.speaker: HUCKABEE
utterances.utterance: Now, I love the Caracas Caucus because quite frankly, if we ever adopt those policies, it will become the American carcass.  There won't be anything left to this economy.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Very good.  Very good.

utterances.speaker: HUCKABEE
utterances.utterance: I'm just shocked that people would take Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez seriously when she talks about a 70% tax rate.  Good heavens.  This destroys the American economy and the very weak that we've had the best job numbers that we've had that show that people of color are particularly better off than they have ever been in American history.  I just cannot understand where she is coming from.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That's right, lowest Hispanic unemployment rate of all time and the biggest growth in manufacturing jobs, Mr. Cain, in I think, 20 years.

utterances.speaker: HERMAN CAIN, CHAIRMAN, AMERICA FIGHTING BACK
utterances.utterance: I'm happy to be on with my good friend, Governor Mike Huckabee.  Hello, Governor.  We haven't talked in a long time.

utterances.speaker: HUCKABEE
utterances.utterance: Hello, Herman.

utterances.speaker: CAIN
utterances.utterance: But your commentary, Jesse was brilliant.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: God, I love having you guys on the show.

utterances.speaker: CAIN
utterances.utterance: I would add one more ...

utterances.speaker: HUCKABEE
utterances.utterance: We're suckers.

utterances.speaker: CAIN
utterances.utterance: ... metaphor to your Caracas caucus and that is the Democrats have demonstrated in two days that they are like a 200-piece orchestra where none of the instruments are tuned and they are trying to play the symphony called "Hate Trump" and it's not working. This is how bad they are.  Ocasio-Cortez is economically illiterate.  She has demonstrated that not just with the comment about taxes ought to be 70% and once you get above making it a ten million, then what - it's not her money. This is what liberals and lunatics misunderstand.  It's not their money.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That's true and you make a good point about the orchestra playing different notes because this is exemplified in the reaction towards this new congresswoman from Michigan.  Let's play the congresswoman from Michigan say the "M R effer" and then let's watch how Democrats in the leadership positions reacted.  Go ahead.

utterances.speaker: TLAIB
utterances.utterance: When your son looks at you and says, "Mama, look you won.  Bullies don't win," and I said, "Baby, they don't.  Because we are going to go in there and we're going to impeach the [bleep]."

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: All right, so she says impeach the "M effer."  This is Nancy Pelosi asked very directly what she thought about that statement.

utterances.speaker: PELOSI
utterances.utterance: I'm not in censorship business.  I don't think that - I mean, I don't like that language.  I wouldn't use that language.  I don't, again establish any language standards for my colleagues, but I don't think it's anything worse than the President and what the President has said. I don't think we should make a big deal of it.  I really don't.  I really don't.  That's probably the way people talk around.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: So that's just how people talk and that's the Speaker of the House, really not taking a hard stance on that kind of language.  This is Congressman Cleaver who had kind of a different thought about it.  Watch this.

utterances.speaker: REP. EMANUEL CLEAVER, D-MO.
utterances.utterance: This young person who just got elected might think this is okay.  I mean, the President calls people names.  I don't know - I don't know her.  I haven't spoken with her.  I have seen the video.  What she did was absolutely wrong.  I'm at this point refusing to accept the nudeness of vulgarity. I heard people on the floor speaking that they were just aghast at what was said.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: So there's already a big fracture, Governor Huckabee, among the Democratic leadership, among the entire House on the Democratic side about this kind of, you know, vulgarity and kind of in-your-face kind of street talk.

utterances.speaker: HUCKABEE
utterances.utterance: Well, let's be fair.  Let's don't blame all the Democrats for something that this new freshman said that was ridiculous, out of order and would have cost me a mouthful of soap had I ever said something like that when I was growing up.  But kudos --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That never happened to you, I don't you.  You probably never use any foul language.

utterances.speaker: HUCKABEE
utterances.utterance: I didn't want to eat soap.  I found other things to eat, but you know, kudos to Congressman Cleaver for being bold enough to not try to defend that because I think it's indefensible, but even more so, it's not just her words about the President, but it's the fact that she's an anti-Semite. I mean, this is a person who put a Post-It note on her map that disavowed the existence of Israel.  This is a dangerous person in the Congress, if her views were to ever catch hold; hopefully, they won't and I would like to think that the people of Michigan and that district are having some real, real buyer's remorse about having sent her to Congress.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Now, I'm playing devil's advocate here, Mr. Cain, people on the other side say you know, President Trump said some pretty vulgar things in the past.  He talks tough on a lot of occasions, you know, to get upset about this language coming from this young congresswoman seems hypocritical.  How do you break that down?

utterances.speaker: CAIN
utterances.utterance: It is hypocritical and here is why.  The President may have said some things that the left and the Democrats don't like, but he never used that level of vulgarity for a member of Congress and she's talking about the President of the United States. I understand that there's a lot of Trump hate in this country, but the Democrats, the Liberals, the progressives and the lunatics, I put them all under the same barrel.  They've taken it one step further and they don't even respect the office of the President and this is something that they have raised to a whole new level and it's uncalled for and unnecessary. I think it's going to backfire because most Americans ...

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I agree.

utterances.speaker: CAIN
utterances.utterance: ... can disagree, but they're not going to accept this kind of vulgarity coming from someone who thinks that they are going to, you know, move the moon that first year in Congress.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I agree.  If they continue with this kind of onslaught of vulgarity and insanity, then, you know, in the next couple months, American people are going to say, "What were we thinking by getting this new congressman?" And I remember, didn't Hillary Clinton say they were going to be uncivil until they regained power back?  Well, they got the power back.  I think they forgot about that.  They're supposed to be civil now.  Let's move to - I think you guys both ran against this guy, Mitt Romney, who made quite a splash this week with a really nasty op-ed against the President's character.  He says he has no dignity in "The Washington Post" and then, he was asked about it.  Let's listen to what he had to say.

utterances.speaker: SEN. MITT ROMNEY, R-UT
utterances.utterance: After he was elected President, it was very much my hope that he would rise to the occasion, rise to the mantle of the office.  I don't think he's followed through on that front the way he's followed through on some of his other promises.

utterances.speaker: JAKE TAPPER, ANCHOR, CNN
utterances.utterance: Do you regret accepting his endorsement when he sent that tweet during your Senate race?

utterances.speaker: ROMNEY
utterances.utterance: He was endorsing me, I wasn't endorsing him and I haven't decided who I'm going to endorse in 2020.  I mean, I'm going to wait and see what the alternatives are.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And President Trump, at least, fired back.  It could have been a little bit worse.  Here's what he had to say in response.

utterances.speaker: PRESIDENT DONALD TRUMP
utterances.utterance: I wish Mitt could be more of a team player, you know.  I'm surprised he did it this quickly.  I was expecting something, but I was surprised he did it this quickly. If he fought really hard against President Obama like he does against me, he would have won the election.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: So you guys both ran against him.  Let's start with you Governor Huckabee, what do you think about the new Mitt or the old Mitt?  Take it away.

utterances.speaker: HUCKABEE
utterances.utterance: It's the same old Mitt, you know.  He was for Donald Trump and Donald Trump gave him money.  He hugged him.  He was so glad for the endorsement.  Then he was against him in the 2016 election when it looked like Trump was going to win.  Then he became against him again because he was going to go to the Senate and he wanted to make some noise. Mitt's into footwear -- flip-flops.  And this week, he put both of his feet in his mouth.  I'm hoping, he's enjoying the flip-flops.  I'm disgusted with Mitt.  I'm just absolutely outraged that he couldn't even wait to get sworn in before he went after his own party. I just hope he will go and work his hard to fight for the American people and a secure border as he will to fight against the President of his own party elected by people who didn't elect him.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Wow.  Okay two flip-flops in the mouth.  What about you Herman Cain?

utterances.speaker: CAIN
utterances.utterance: When I first heard about the op-ed, I said to myself, "Senator Mitt Romney is the new flake," which means, he will say anything to get attention and that's what he's doing.  Let me share a story with you about Mitt Romney that I haven't shared publicly, Jesse. When I was running for President and immediately decided that they were going to believe the accusers, never asked me.  They didn't want to believe me and I dropped out of the race.  So in 2012, I met with Governor Mitt Romney - candidate Romney who had - was about to get the nomination and I gave him advice on three separate sit down occasions. Do you know how much of that advice he used?  None.  One of them was, "Mitt, your 27-point tax plan is never going to fly."  I said, "Mitt, you need to develop some new talking points while you're out on the campaign trail."  His staff, I believe systematically talked him into not listening to me. So what he did to basically flip-flop on the President is another indication that he is not a true leader.  He has been over managed by some of the people around him and that makes me even more disgusted not because he didn't listen to me.  I don't have all the answers, but because he doesn't appear to be his own man.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You know, that leads me to a story that I've never told publicly when I interviewed him when I was just a little scrappy street correspondent.  I went up to his suite at a hotel where they were having a big conference and I walked in and there was about 12 guys in Brooks Brothers suits with perfect hair and they had computer screens set up all over the place with a bunch of monitors with dials going everywhere and it was it was like - it was like Mitt was an android and he was a computerized guy that just had consultants and wires running through his brain. And he just wasn't his own man and that's just - you know, and I feel bad because I voted for him, but, you know, I like you guys because you guys think I'm brilliant.  So we'll leave it at that.  Gentlemen, thank you, guys, very much.

utterances.speaker: CAIN
utterances.utterance: Thanks, Jesse.

utterances.speaker: HUCKABEE
utterances.utterance: Thank you, Jesse.  Thank you, Herman

utterances.speaker: CAIN
utterances.utterance: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: All right, a woman's march postponed because it was two whites -- yes, they postponed the march because too many white people were involved.  The organizer is here to explain why she did this, up next.

utterances.speaker: PELOSI
utterances.utterance: In my view-- ineffective, too expensive, almost immoral -- immoral. The wall -- immoral, ineffective, and expensive. It is not effective that costs billions of dollars. The wall is an immorality.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That's Nancy Pelosi calling the border wall immoral, ineffective, costly many times this last year and she still won't fund it, not even one dollar.  Well maybe a dollar she said.  President Trump however says a border wall is necessary and non-negotiable.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: We need protection in our country.  We're going to make it good.  The people of our country want it.  I have never had so much support as I have in the last week over my stance for border security, for border control and for frankly, the wall or the barrier. I have never had anything like it in terms of calls coming in, in terms of people writing in and tweeting and doing whatever they have to do.  I've never had this much support.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And members of the National Border Patrol backed up the President.

utterances.speaker: BRANDON JUDD, PRESIDENT, NATIONAL BORDER PATROL COUNCIL
utterances.utterance: Anywhere that you look where we have built walls, they have worked.  They have been an absolute necessity for Border Patrol agents in securing the border.

utterances.speaker: ART DEL CUETO, VICE PRESIDENT, NATIONAL BORDER PATROL COUNCIL
utterances.utterance: You all have got to ask yourself this question, "If I come to your home, do you want me to knock on the front door or do you want me to climb through that window?

utterances.speaker: HECTOR GARZA, VICE PRESIDENT, NATIONAL BORDER PATROL COUNCIL
utterances.utterance: These criminal aliens that have been released from jail that have been deported will come right back into the United States; however, if we had a physical barrier, if we had a wall, we will be able to stop that.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Joining me now, co-founder of Run for America and progressive commentator, David Bernstein; and founder of Turning Point USA, Charlie Kirk.  So Charlie, it looks like these Border Patrol guys basically called Nancy Pelosi a stone-faced liar.  She's been running around the country saying, "Walls don't work." The guys on the ground are saying everywhere we put a wall, they work.

utterances.speaker: CHARLIE KIRK, FOUNDER, TURNING POINT USA
utterances.utterance: That's right and when polled, 95% of Border Patrol agents said a wall would better help them do their job, so shouldn't we listen to the people actually on the front lines keeping our country safe against drug traffickers and the flow of guns into our country. And look, this is a fundamental issue not just about American sovereignty and about safety, but whether or not the Democrats are happy to send hundreds of millions, if not billions of dollars to other countries across the globe, yet they're against building a wall or building a barrier to protect our own country. They're happy to send money to countries that burn the American flag, but they're not okay with spending money to protect America itself.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That's a great point.  It looks like $54 billion we send overseas in foreign aid.  Look at the other items the Democrats want to fund -- the Obamacare website.  How much did that cost?  That thing broke and it's over $2 billion.  Solyndra - that failed scheme half a billion, cash for Clunkers.  Remember that doozy?  That's just $3 billion and all he's asking for, David is $5 billion for the wall. I mean, talk about priorities.  They funded the wall before, why won't they fund this one?

utterances.speaker: DAVID BERNSTEIN, CO-FOUNDER, RUN FOR AMERICA
utterances.utterance: I think we could add the wall to to that list of failed programs that's up there.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: So disagree with the Border Patrol agents that say walls work.  Are you calling the Border Patrol agents liars?  Are you?

utterances.speaker: BERNSTEIN
utterances.utterance: It is not to say that we shouldn't have a barrier fence.  We have barriers now and in fact, the problem is still, we're still talking about it and this President got elected on the basis of this.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Right, so - but he says, where there are barriers, what it does is funnel the illegal alien foot traffic to softer spots.

utterances.speaker: BERNSTEIN
utterances.utterance: I think the problem with the President's approach to this is that - is making a wall the centerpiece of our immigration policy.  I don't think - I'm not against having a fence.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: How would you secure the southern border?

utterances.speaker: BERNSTEIN
utterances.utterance: I think the reality is that having a fence - having it --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: President David, how would President David secure --

utterances.speaker: BERNSTEIN
utterances.utterance: I'm certainly not asking to be President, but they're --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I just elected you, go.  How would you secure the southern border, go.

utterances.speaker: BERNSTEIN
utterances.utterance: The reality is that having agents across the border as we do, the President has put - the President has put agents on the border and said that the border is secured.  Now, a couple of weeks ago, right, he said it so.  Why does he need $5 billion for a wall when he said that he sent troops to the border and now the border is secure. So the idea that suddenly, he now needs a wall --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: If you look at the border, it doesn't secure to me.  It does not look secure ...

utterances.speaker: BERNSTEIN
utterances.utterance: Well, the President - the President is ...

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Look at the visuals - now, listen, if you look at the visuals, Charlie, and see people throwing rocks at Border Patrol agents, I think there's a statistic here, it says the Border Patrol announced that assaults against agents spiked 300% after the caravan.  Doesn't Nancy Pelosi have a wall around her house?  Don't all of these Democrats have structures --

utterances.speaker: KIRK
utterances.utterance: Yes, doesn't Maxine Waters, and - yes, exactly.  If the walls don't work, then just go take down the walls around all of your mansions in California.  I mean, if walls don't work, you know, why does the Vatican have them?  If walls don't work, why does Israel - these other countries start to build them? Look - and every Democrat knows this, they're intentionally demagoguing this subject because they need illegal immigration to keep themselves politically viable in the future.  They are losing Middle America.  They're losing black America and they're quickly losing, you know, the Latino Americans. If you look this just this week, lowest ever Hispanic unemployment rate and that's legal immigrants.  Look, the President has said all along, he's a big fan of legal immigration.  He is not a fan or a supporter of line cutting or border jumping and look, we are behind the President a hundred percent. I'll tell you, he has to hold the line on here to build the wall. It is his core promise, defend our sovereignty and look the arguments I'm hearing against it is, "Oh, he's already done it."  Well, no, he's done it on 600 miles of it, but it's thousands of miles long complete - complete the wall and then you'll be able to secure the border and make our country safer.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: As much as I hate to do this, I'm going to give David the last word, please respond to Charlie when he says, do you support line cutting or respond to the Border Patrol guys that say would you rather have someone knock at your front door or break in through the back window?  Thirty seconds.

utterances.speaker: BERNSTEIN
utterances.utterance: I think we would all rather have someone knock at the front door, but that would require a sensible, comprehensive immigration policy and the way you create that is not by negotiating during a shutdown to have $5 billion to build the wall.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: All right.  Very good.  Thank you, guys, very much.  Up next, Elizabeth Warren drinks a beer. You've got to see this thing.  Dean Cain and I examine the corniest political stunts in recent memory.

utterances.speaker: ALICIA ACUNA, CORRESPONDENT
utterances.utterance: Live from "America's News Headquarters," I'm Alicia Acuna.  A meeting to bring the partial government shutdown to an end doesn't produce much progress.  Vice President Mike Pence held talks earlier today with senior White House officials and congressional staff in Washington.  While the Vice President touted the meeting as quote "productive" on Twitter, no deal was reached.  The shutdown is now in its 15th day.  President Trump wants more than $5 billion to build the wall, but Democrats have refused to give in to his requests. Russian officials are downplaying suggestions that a former U.S. Marine arrested on espionage charges is being held as a pawn in a prisoner swap.  A Russian woman pled guilty last month in the U.S. to acting as a foreign agent to the Kremlin.  Paul Whelan's family says he was in the country for a wedding and is not a spy.  I'm Alicia Acuna.  Now back to "Watters' World."  For all your headlines, log on to foxnews.com.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: This week, Elizabeth Warren otherwise known as Pocahontas to some, announced she's launching a Presidential Exploratory Committee.  So she posted this video on Instagram in hopes of becoming more likable.  Watch.

utterances.speaker: SEN. ELIZABETH WARREN, D-MASS.
utterances.utterance: Hold on a second, I'm going get me a beer.  Hey, my husband Bruce is now in here.  You want a beer?

utterances.speaker: BRUCE WARREN, HUSBAND OF ELIZABETH WARREN
utterances.utterance: No, I'll pass on the beer for now.

utterances.speaker: E. WARREN
utterances.utterance: You sure?  I can save one.  I am going to sit down.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I can't - I can't, so is this a stunt or is this the real Elizabeth Warren?  We have no idea, so we brought Dean Cain in to discuss.  So she's a Harvard professor, get me a beer.

utterances.speaker: DEAN CAIN, AMERICAN ACTOR
utterances.utterance: I think I'm going get me long pause as you thought about what was she going to get herself?  A beer.  Yes, no.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And then the husband, "Hey, do you want a beer?"  No.  He doesn't want to be a part of this thing.

utterances.speaker: CAIN
utterances.utterance: But the good thing is, that she thanks him for being in their house, which is really important.  You know, thank you for being here.  He's like, "Well, yes, I live here."  All right, whatever.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: This is my house, too.

utterances.speaker: CAIN
utterances.utterance: What's going on?  Yes, that wasn't the best way she could have come out to be authentic in having a sit down thing.  She was trying to be, you know, Ocasio-Cortez or whoever she was doing --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes, because she was doing that cooking thing on the internet and she probably does cook online a lot and this was a little forced, I would say.

utterances.speaker: CAIN
utterances.utterance: Yes, it's a fair --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: A little forced.  I don't want to be too much, but Michelob Ultra was the drink.

utterances.speaker: CAIN
utterances.utterance: Was that what it was?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I would have gone with Sam Adams since she's from Massachusetts.

utterances.speaker: CAIN
utterances.utterance: Michelob Ultra?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Michelob Ultra.  Maybe, she's trying to slim down for the race.  I don't know, I think she looks fine to me.  But Michelob Ultra, I mean, that's not the beer drinker's beer.

utterances.speaker: CAIN
utterances.utterance: That's not the go-to.  I would not have gone with that.  I didn't see that coming.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: No, no.  This reminded me of a few other things back in the day.  Remember Hilary when she was trying to act hip and the she was trying to do some dance on "Ellen."  Remember this?

utterances.speaker: CAIN
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: What dance was that?  You know that.

utterances.speaker: CAIN
utterances.utterance: That's the whip, now we "nae, nae."

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That's right.

utterances.speaker: CAIN
utterances.utterance: Right there, "and whip, now we nae, nae."

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Oh, god.  It just makes me uncomfortable watching this.

utterances.speaker: CAIN
utterances.utterance: That is not -- and then plus, you should know better than to try to dance next to Twitch anyway because he is a ridiculous dancer, so I --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Or Ellen.

utterances.speaker: CAIN
utterances.utterance: Ellen - well Ellen is good, but she doesn't - not like Twitch.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Not like Twitch.

utterances.speaker: CAIN
utterances.utterance: Not like Twitch.  Twitch is for real.  That was --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I haven't done the show, I don't know Twitch.

utterances.speaker: CAIN
utterances.utterance: Well, he's a great dancer.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Okay.  I can see that.  Speaking of great answers, Mitt Romney that we just talked about at the top of the show.  Do you remember this incident when he was on the campaign trail?  I think he was trying to act cool.  Here we go.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Who let the dogs out?

utterances.speaker: ROMNEY
utterances.utterance: Who?  Who?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Who let the dogs out?  Dead silence.

utterances.speaker: CAIN
utterances.utterance: Yes, what was - I know, don't do that.  No, I mean I get people will try to look cool and Hillary wants hot sauce and that, you just really be authentic.  Try to be yourselves.  I don't I don't get that.  That didn't - that does not work.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Do you hunt by the way?

utterances.speaker: CAIN
utterances.utterance: I do not hunt.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Neither does John Kerry.  Do remember this one?  I think, this was what?  2004?  He went out there and put some clothes on.  Yes, there he is.  That's John Kerry in the most camouflage you can put on one human being.

utterances.speaker: CAIN
utterances.utterance: I can't - he's so camouflaged, I can't even see him.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You can't even see him.  Which one is Kerry?  There's people there?  I can't even see.  And this reminds me of another Massachusetts guy, Michael Dukakis, the infamous inauthenticity.  Look, tough guy Dukakis right there.

utterances.speaker: CAIN
utterances.utterance: That does not help.  That is not helpful.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It's not helpful to anybody.  Even the Army was like, get him out of there.

utterances.speaker: CAIN
utterances.utterance: Yes, and then he put his name on it so he make sure you knew it was him and it was Dukakis across the thing.  Can't do that.  You get caught for being inauthentic, you're sunk or you should be.  I mean, like, "Yeah," right.  That's something - one little gaffe like that, it's ...

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It's curtains.

utterances.speaker: CAIN
utterances.utterance: It's horrible.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Well, I mean, because she's coming off the biggest gaffe of all time claiming she was Native American.

utterances.speaker: CAIN
utterances.utterance: It just begs every single time, you know, I saw a Warren 2020 poster that said, "Warren 1/2020th chance to win."  I mean, it's just --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I mean, the jokes write themselves.  Let's go to Donald Trump who made some people laugh, just some amazing free association and really entertaining commentary when he was in the - at the White House the other day.  Riff it, go.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: When I say "I'm sorry, folks, you have to pay up," I shouldn't be popular in Europe. I don't care about Europe.  I'm not elected by Europeans.  I'm elected by Americans and by American taxpayers, frankly.  So you know, I think my relationship, I will tell you what the leaders of Europe is very good. So Taliban is our enemy.  ISIS is our enemy.  They're both our enemies.  Let them fight.  Sir, we want to do it.  Then, they go in and they end up fighting both of them.  It's the craziest thing I've ever seen.  I think I would have been a good general, but who knows? Iran - when I became President, I had a meeting at the Pentagon with lots of generals.  They were like from a movie, better-looking than Tom Cruise and stronger, and I had more generals than I've ever seen. I was here on Christmas evening.  I was all by myself in the White House.  It's a big, big house except for all the guys out on the lawn with machine guns.  The nicest machine guns up.  I was waving to them.  I never saw so many guys with machine guns in my life.  Secret Service and military, these are great people and they don't play games.  They don't like wave.  They don't even smile. But I was there all alone with the machine gunners and I felt very safe.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You love this.

utterances.speaker: CAIN
utterances.utterance: I love it because he just - no, you want to talk about authenticity, that's authentic.  That's him being him.  Now, he was jumping around.  There was a lot of stuff going on. He said some very funny things.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I like the generals line.

utterances.speaker: CAIN
utterances.utterance: The "better-looking than Tom Cruise and stronger."

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And stronger.  Were you in the meeting?  That was you.  Dean Cain was there.

utterances.speaker: CAIN
utterances.utterance: I will agree with him on that.  He is authentic though.  You say what you want to about the things he said, it's kind of the kind of way you would have a conversation around the dinner table though.  People are speaking like that around the dinner table all the time and I think he's really being authentic and I think that's the difference between him and some of those other folks we were talking about, you know, two minutes ago.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That's right.  All right, Dean Cain, everybody.  There he is, Mr. Authenticity.  Okay, up next, the women's march postponed because it's too white.  That's right, it was too white, so they had the postpone it.  The organizer up later.  But up next, Diamond and Silk, there they are.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: House Speaker Nancy Pelosi already making waves with President Trump.  Here's what she told "The Today Show's" Savannah Guthrie when asked if she thinks Trump deals with her differently because she's a woman.

utterances.speaker: PELOSI
utterances.utterance: We'll see maybe now that - how he will deal with the Speaker of the House.  I hope he recognizes that a new day has dawned in America. I don't know if he knows how to deal with women in power and women with strength, but we'll see.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Here to react, two of the strongest women I know right here, Diamond and Silk -- ladies, I know how President Trump deals with strong women.  He dealt with Hillary.  He beat her.

utterances.speaker: DIAMOND, VIDEOBLOGGER
utterances.utterance: Absolutely, and listen the President does not have a problem with working women.  The problem comes in when you have a Congress that don't want to work.  They want to go and play games.

utterances.speaker: SILK, VIDEOBLOGGER
utterances.utterance: That's right.

utterances.speaker: DIAMOND
utterances.utterance: We don't have time for it.  They want to pass the buck instead of doing what the American people want.  The problem is Congress who need to do their job and that's what Pelosi needs to be focused on, not on the President.

utterances.speaker: SILK
utterances.utterance: And for women like Pelosi that don't want to do their jobs, that's not a strong woman, that's a weak woman.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You know, people always say you know Trump, I don't know if he can get along with women and this and that.  He treats women the same way he treats men.  I mean Megyn Kelly, Rosie O'Donnell, Ted Cruz, Jim Acosta - he gets right in their face and tells them how he thinks.  I don't think playing the gender card on Trump works, but what do I know?  I'm just "Watters' World." Let's go to McDonald's, my favorite restaurant, huge brawl because their new straw policy is making everyone crazy.  You know the plastic straw things.  They don't put them up front anymore.  You have to ask, well, all hell broke loose.  Watch this. Wow.  What is that lady?  What's that?  A Big Mac attack?

utterances.speaker: DIAMOND
utterances.utterance: Okay, well, wait a minute, Jesse.  Listen, for every action, there's an equal and opposite reaction.

utterances.speaker: SILK
utterances.utterance: That's right.

utterances.speaker: DIAMOND
utterances.utterance: And listen, he better be glad that that wasn't Diamond and Silk, because we would have beat him down like he had stolen a straw, okay.  First of all, you don't put your hands on anyone because that's assault and that girl, she - that was her reaction.

utterances.speaker: SILK
utterances.utterance: That's right.

utterances.speaker: DIAMOND
utterances.utterance: Look, mister, using her fist - her fist was her weapon that day.

utterances.speaker: SILK
utterances.utterance: That's right.

utterances.speaker: DIAMOND
utterances.utterance: And she won the battle.

utterances.speaker: SILK
utterances.utterance: And she used it well.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Okay, that was the last straw as my producers said.  Okay, let's move on.  Anderson Cooper, we all know him as the CNN host.  He had the duty of doing the very wet New Year's Eve last week and I guess they're allowed to drink on CNN.  They can't do it at Fox News, but I guess, CNN lets the hosts drink.  He took a few shots and I think it was his first time.  Watch this.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.utterance: We're going to have some shots.

utterances.speaker: ANDY COHEN, TELEVISION PRODUCER
utterances.utterance: I brought shots.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.utterance: I'm not a big drinker.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.utterance: Top of every hour.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.utterance: Top of every hour.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.utterance: He's not a big drinker.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.utterance: You feel like joining us at home.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.utterance: Cheers, but don't drink and drive whatsoever.  Call a Lyft, call an Uber.  Get a cab.  Get a friend.  Get a car.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.utterance: All right.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.utterance: Cheers.  First one of the night.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.utterance: Delicious, I feel better already.  Anderson made me promise not to complain about the weather because --

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.utterance: I feel like my lungs are scorched.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.utterance: Good.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It's like it's his first time drinking.

utterances.speaker: DIAMOND
utterances.utterance: And listen, I think they did it at the top of every hour, but it's really, you know, they're such hypocrites.

utterances.speaker: SILK
utterances.utterance: Hypocrites.

utterances.speaker: DIAMOND
utterances.utterance: They were being so hypocritical.  When it came to Kavanaugh and him drinking beer, but yes, they are on television, throwing back tequila shots like a fish drinking water.  And to us, it looked like Anderson Cooper was drinking hot water because he couldn't stand all of that stuff down his throat.

utterances.speaker: SILK
utterances.utterance: That's right.

utterances.speaker: DIAMOND
utterances.utterance: Here's our moral of the story.  Stop drinking, Anderson.  Don't drink nothing like that.  Don't put any alcohol in your body.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes, save the drinks for Diamond and Silk and Jesse Watters.  We will handle it from here, all right.  Ladies, you guys are going on tour, I know and you're going to be at the Trump Hotel February 23rd, I believe and that's going to be a hell of a "Chitchat Tour" there in D.C.

utterances.speaker: DIAMOND
utterances.utterance: Oh, yes.  That's the kickoff.

utterances.speaker: SILK
utterances.utterance: Go to chitchat.com.  Get your tickets.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: All right, there they are.  Also on Fox Nation, check them out there.  Ladies, thank you guys very much.  Speaking of ladies, the women's march postponed because - not rain, it's too white, all right, later in the show. And later Americans fail basic geography.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Greenland or Iceland or something.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: That's Alaska.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: Any country on the entire map.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: A women's march in California was postponed earlier this week.  Organizers pulled the plug on the January 19th march in Humboldt County, California because it was too white.  Here to explain the decision, Kelsey Reedy, one of the organizers of the Eureka Women's March in Humboldt County. All right, Kelsey, I thought the Women's March was about being a woman, not about what race you were?

utterances.speaker: KELSEY REEDY, ORGANIZER, EUREKA WOMEN'S MARCH
utterances.utterance: It is about being a woman, but we also acknowledge that it needs to represent all women and not just some women.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: So you thought that the Women's March was going to marginalize other women?

utterances.speaker: REEDY
utterances.utterance: Without their voices being represented, yes, that is what we feared.  We are postponing it because of a lack of representation from our leadership team and not just the participants.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Okay, does it - does it matter the race of the women that's in the march?  Why does the race matter?  I thought it was about the content of their character, not the color of their skin?

utterances.speaker: REEDY
utterances.utterance: So again, this march is not representative of the people in Humboldt County, but again like having this march to be just a response to the inauguration of Trump is really missing the underlying issues and that's what we want to focus on. So Trump is only a symptom of the larger problems of patriarchy, white supremacy and capitalism, which are all under the umbrella of colonialism.  So without making sure that we're representing women who are impacted by all these systems, then we wouldn't be doing it right.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Colonialism?

utterances.speaker: REEDY
utterances.utterance: Correct.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: What does America have to do with colonialism?

utterances.speaker: REEDY
utterances.utterance: Well, all the headlines are talking about the overwhelmingly whiteness of Humboldt County and that's not fair to say without acknowledging why that is the case and that is the case because of  the genocide of indigenous peoples.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Okay, so that's the reason you guys cancelled the march because hundreds of years ago, your white ancestors killed a lot of Native Americans here?

utterances.speaker: REEDY
utterances.utterance: We postponed it, not canceled it and we can't - we postponed it because the leadership of who was putting on the march did not represent who all were living in our community and so having, you know, an event that is labeled by [bleep] hats would cause more damage to people who identify as indigenous because they already had to experience the horrifying-ness of having American soldiers cutting their reproductive organs out and their genitalia out and wearing them as hats.  So the fact that this march is symbolled by the [bleep] hats, is just exactly what it is that we want to work against.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Wow, just a lot to digest there.  I could do a whole hour with you, Kelsey.  Last question, I think one of the closest NBA teams, the Sacramento Kings plays near you guys, do you think the Sacramento Kings are too black of a team?

utterances.speaker: REEDY
utterances.utterance: I do not follow sports at all.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Okay, I'm just wondering because they don't represent you know, the overall population of California or Sacramento.  I don't know.  I don't know, but I just have to say you're very sensitive.  You are probably the most sensitive guest we've ever had on "Watters' World," besides me who is extremely sensitive and it seems like you care a lot about the feelings of other people especially the feelings of other people, hundreds and hundreds of years ago and I respect that Kelsey. Kelsey, hopefully when you guys get the march back, you guys have more diversity, so everybody feels included.

utterances.speaker: REEDY
utterances.utterance: Yes, that is our goal for the march that we are working towards on the International Women's Day in March.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: All right, thank you very much, Kelsey.

utterances.speaker: REEDY
utterances.utterance: No problem.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Up next, "Last Call."  It is the worst geography quiz you'll ever see.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Time now for "Last Call."  I was checking out social media the other day and came across this crazy clip from "Jimmy Kimmel Live."  It aired a few months ago, but everybody always says "Watters, your street interviews, it's a set up.  People can't be that dull."  But watch this.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: Could you do many countries in Africa?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: No.  Who know stuff like that?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: Can you name any country on this map?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Yes.  Africa.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: That's a continent.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Oh, country.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Greenland or Iceland or something.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: That's Alaska.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: Any country.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: And you know --

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: And on the entire map.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: This is so horrible.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: Where's America?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: I would say the big one, but I'm probably wrong.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: Is that - hang on.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: Okay.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: Can you name any country on this map?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: Oh my gosh.  Shouldn't I be taught this in school?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: I would hope so.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: South America.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: That's a continent.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: Oh my god.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: How about a country in South America?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: Yes, Honduras is here.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: Nope.

utterances.utterance: Here.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: Nope.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: Here.

utterances.utterance: Nope.

utterances.utterance: Here.

utterances.utterance: Nope.

utterances.utterance: Here.

utterances.utterance: Nope.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: Somewhere here.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: Nope.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
